data.title: Parentacion solemne, que al nombre augusto, y real memoria de la Catholica Reyna de las Españas ... Doña Maria Amalia de Saxonia ... dia 27 de Junio de 1761 / el Señor Don Joseph Manso de Velasco ...
data.meta_description: This book contains an account of the services held at Lima in June 1761 to commemorate the death of Maria Amalia of Saxony, the consort of Charles III of Spain. Maria Amalia had married Charles in 1759 and set about a series of reforms to modernise the Spanish court. She died suddenly in 1760. The book was written by the Viceroy of Peru, Jose Antonio Manso de Velasco, Count of Superunda. Services were held at Lima Cathedral, which was being rebuilt following the 1746 Lima earthquake.
